org.xlattice.util.context

Interface Term

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Literal, Symbol

    public interface Term
    A context Term is part of an expression, a Literal or a Symbol, where a literal is something that cannot be resolved further, and a Symbol is a substring bracketed by ${ and }, which can be resolved.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int from() 
      java.lang.String resolve(Context ctx)
      Evaluate the term within the context.
      int to() 

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        java.lang.String resolve(Context ctx)
        Evaluate the term within the context.
        Returns:
        what the term evaluates to as a String

      • from

        int from()
        Returns:
        offset of the first character of the term

      • to

        int to()
        Returns:
        offset of the first character beyond the term
